item.title: Report E-2025010244
item.description:
Report E-2025010244

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-21
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a two metal totes containing hazardous product, Unisol Liquid Red BK 50. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 0.5-gallon release from two metal totes that impacted 1’x1’ areas on tops and sides of the totes, the wooden trailer floor, and the concrete dock floor. One of the totes had a loose bung cap that was mis-threaded, and the other tote had a loose lid that was easily tightened. The contractor used simple green to clean-up the release and performed slosh tests on the totes. One 55-gallon DM of waste was generated containing impacted rags, floor debris, and PPE. The totes will ship onto the consignee. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025010212
item.description:
Report E-2025010212

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-18
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LEP experienced a UN2735 Niax Catalyst C-232 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 6’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damage drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents and pads were then utilized to clean the impacted area. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

item.title: Report E-2025010208
item.description:
Report E-2025010208

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding crushed boxes with plastic jugs containing hazardous product, Kathon. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 2-gallons of product released onto the wooden trailer floor in a 4’x4’ area and the concrete beneath the trailer in a 10’x3’ area as a result of improper blocking and bracing. The contractor neutralized the release using vinegar and containerized two empty jugs last containing product along with absorbents, cardboard, pallet pieces, and PPE. One 55-gallon DF was generated for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • City: NORWALK

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 16, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1760 was punctured and released approximately 5-gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized neutralizing agent and absorbents to remediate the site. The damaged drum was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon overpack and all other waste was collected in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010205
item.description:
Report E-2025010205

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-15
  • City: CREST HILL
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 56ft-by-6ft area of the trailer floor and the dock floor and estimated that seventy-five (75) gallons of material was released due to a forklift puncturing one (1) 55-gallon metal drum of Hi-Temp 1200 causing it to knock over into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum of PBTCA damaging it. Before Clean Harbors’ arrival, Dayton Freight personnel had placed both damaged drums into two (2) 85-gallon overpacks. Clean Harbors personnel deployed the neutralizer sodium bicarbonate and granular absorbents to the impacted area. They used a pH strip to test the paint inside the metal drum which resulted in a neutral result. All impacted absorbents were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to contractor demobilization. After departing off site, Clean Harbors personnel were asked to return to assist with the transfer of the contents of one (1) 85-gallon metal overpack drum to a one (1) 85-gallon poly drum due to the corrosive nature of the contained material. One (1) 85-gallon ploy drum was used to contain neutralizers and granular absorbents utilized during the transfer. Clean Harbors personnel staged one (1) 55-gallon poly drum, one (1) 85-gallon metal drum, and three (3) 85-gallon poly drums onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 14, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon drum of UN3266 was damaged and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized hand tools, absorbents, soda ash, and a pH testing strip to remediate the impacted trailer. One (1) 55-gallon drum of cleanup debris and impacted material, and one (1) 55-gallon drum containing the damaged product were staged onsite.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-14
  • City: PARMA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PITT OHIO EXPRESS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Upon arrival at the destination terminal, this tote was discovered leaking inside the trailer. The tote was immediately turned on it's side to prevent further release. After investigation, it was determined that this tote was damaged due to a load shift during transit. An empty tote was used as dunnage to protect the tote and a piece of wood on the skid broke and was pushed into the tote, causing puncture. The material was a thick liquid and was contained to the trailer floor. The material was absorbed using absorbent material and placed into an overpack container for later disposal.

The entire shipment was being held, pending an FAA investigation, after which the shipper will be contacted for further disposition instructions.

item.title: Report X-2025010709
item.description:
Report X-2025010709

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-11
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 1/13/2025 at approximately 1030, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 261690 at the ramp facility in Anchorage, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing 10 inner boxes, and each of those contained 10 plastic bags containing safety matches. The shipment was flagged and opened by the Customs division. The Commercial Invoice identified the inner contents as "arithmetical bar"; however, Customs discovered a contradicting image in X-ray screening. Upon making the discovery, Customs submitted the package to FedEx Dangerous Goods department for proper reporting. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations missing the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2025010200
item.description:
Report E-2025010200

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-10
  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 20000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal BCH experienced a UN3082 Rhonox Herbicide release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 165-gallons of product released due to a forklift puncture. The entire trailer floor, a 150’ x 30’ area of the concrete lot below, and 4 drains and 1 catch basin were impacted. All drains lead to the catch basin where the material was contained. The crew utilized a vac truck to remove the product from the catch basin and drains leading to it. Absorbents were deployed to the trailer and concrete lot and worked in. Once the drains were done, absorbent boom was placed in them to collect any residual material. The product remaining the damaged tote was pumped out and the damaged tote was cut up and containerized. Crew returned to site and inspected the drains and flushed and vacuumed them out again. Additional wastewater was generated to be offloaded into totes. Samples were collected to confirm that no residual material remains in the catch basin and samples were collected from the nearby retention pond as well as a precaution. All wastewater was offloaded into totes and all solid cleanup debris was containerized into 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When the warehouseman can in for work he went out to inspect the Wearhouse and found a poly drum on a pallet with material on the floor under the skid. He then put down some absorbent and called our emergency response. A team was dispatched to the facility and arrived at 0900 et. They determined that the crew did not have the proper PPE to handle the material. The material was contained and not actively leaking. There was not a crew available with the proper PPE until the next morning and they showed up at 0600et and began cleaning up the material and placing the drum into a salvage drum. the material was cleaned up with absorbent material and placed into the proper shipping container to be disposed of. The clean up was completed by 0830et.

  • Description: On January 14, 2025, four (4) 1-gallon pails of paint were punctured and released approximately 8-ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2025010181
item.description:
Report E-2025010181

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-14
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) quarts of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails flipping over in the trailer and leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and damaged container and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. Three (3) 5-gallon poly drums were also used to contain three additional jugs of product due to contamination. A total of five (5) 5-gallon poly drums of waste were generated from this spill. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 13, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of methanol was damaged and released approximately 40-gallons to the trailer floor, asphalt beneath the trailer, and further migrated to a storm drain. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. The crew overpacked the drum in one (1) 95-gallon drum. Absorbents and hand tools were used to remediate all impacted locations. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2025010667
item.description:
Report X-2025010667

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-11
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: BNSF personnel identified a potential release from the TILX 360231 while the car was in the Pasco Bowl Track 43. The car was isolated pending inspection by BNSF Hazmat personnel. Upon inspection, gasoline vapor was found emitting from the manway between the nozzle and hinged lid. The manway was opened and found that the gasket was misaligned and not sealing completely. The gasket was replaced with a nozzle gasket and the lid secured. A new seal was installed and the car was released. There were no identified ground impacts from the release and gasoline spilled on the car had evaporated. Estimated release volume is based upon responder observations.

item.description:
Report E-2025010168

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-11
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) gallons of material released from two (2) 5-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it and the damaged pails into two (2) 10-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately thirty (30) gallons of material released from six (6) 5-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010126
item.description:
Report E-2025010126

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-10
  • City: SAN JOSE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USJ experienced a UN3267 35 High Mod LV- Part B release from (40) 2-gallon metal pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to multiple 6” x 6” areas of the wood trailer floor The pails were leaking from the seams of the lids, handles, and base due to defective packaging. All pails were containerized into (2) 85-gallon poly drums. The impacted areas were cleaned with absorbents which were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: HAMPSHIRE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately eight (8) ounces of material released from one (1) 275-gallon IBC poly tote due to a gash at the top of the tote. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010165
item.description:
Report E-2025010165

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-04
  • City: HAHNVILLE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OCCIDENTAL CHEMICAL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On Saturday, January 4, 2025, a Occidental Chemical driver made a delivery of Hydrochloric Acid to the Occidental Chemical plant located in Hahnville, LA. The Occidental Chemical driver was loaded at an IMTT facility located in Geismar, LA. While the unloading process was underway, it was discovered that the bleeder valve on the product transfer line that goes to the product storage tank was left open. This resulted in approximately 2,500 gallons of Hydrochloric acid being released from the product line into the containment area. No injuries or exposure to chemical occurred as a result of this event, as well as no off-site impact or environmental impact. The offloading process was halted, bleeder valve closed, containment area drained to sump for processing, and remainder of offload was completed.

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-31
  • City: GOODYEAR

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RECIEVED A CALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE AND RESPONDER TO THE AREA. UPON ARIVING ON SCENE RESPONDER FOUND A PLAIN WHITE SMALL BUBBLE MAILER HAD BEEN CONTAMINATED BY ANOTHER PACKAGE SO WAS BROUGHT BACK TO PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ONCE BACK TO PSC RESPONDER OPENED THE BUBBLE MAILER TO FIND A 12 GAUGE LAUNCHER AND AERIAL SIGNAL PACK WITHIN THE BUBBLE MAILER. RESPONDER THEN NOTIFIED THE RMP ABOUT A POSSIBLE UNDECLARED AND FOLLOWED PROPER PRECEDURES OF UNDECLAREDS. RESPONDER THEN LOOKED UP THE SAFETY DATA SHEET OF THE PRODUCT FOR INSIGHT ON THE SHIPPING/HANDLING REQUIREMENTS OF THE PRODUCT.

  • Description: The driver stopped to get fuel and when he was performing a walk around he noticed liquid dripping from the back of the trailer at 1130 et. The driver then put down som absorbent and called our emergency number. A team was dispatched to the truck stop and arrived around 1300 et. They found that one of the IBC flexible bags was leaking and began to repack them into a new container cleaning up any material with absorbents. The container was repacked and everything was cleaned up by 1500et and the driver was sent on his way.

item.title: Report E-2024120516
item.description:
Report E-2024120516

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-19
  • City: Oshkosh
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CONVENIENCE TRANSPORTATION LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 67750
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Our vehicle was approaching a controlled intersection at 10 MPH. To our left, a vehicle (Class 5 or 6 pickup towing equipment) was turning onto the roadway. Conditions were wet and snowy, the other vehicle lost control. The other unit spun out and his trailer came around and hit our truck and tank. The other driver's trailer broke away from the pickup and lodged into the side of our tanker, thus resulting in a puncture to the middle compartment. The puncture is located about two thirds of the way down, in the middle compartment. Our driver maintained full control of his vehicle, stopped immediately, and initiated spill protocol. The road closure was to secure the accident scene and reopened upon vehicle removal. Pictures and reports are attached.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-18
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0231 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BCA. It was reported that approximately 1-cup of Nitric Acid released from a metal drum due a packaging defect by the shipper. The release impacted the top of the drum only. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of UN2031 Nitric Acid product released at top of the metal drum lid 24” area due to not being tighten enough. The contractors replaced the bung cap, and shake tested the drum and used absorbent rags to wipe up the spill, then containerized the impacted rags and a goosenecked bag of PPE into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed there was approximately 2-gallons of product impacted the trailer floor in a 20’ x 4’ area due to improper blocking & bracing of the cargo. The contractors neutralized the impacted floor with sodium bicarbonate. The contractors containerized (2) 2.5-gallon plastic pails of Lime and Scale Remover into (1) 55-gallon poly drum, neutralized absorbents and pallet pieces were placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. item.title: Report E-2024120275
item.description:
Report E-2024120275

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-06
  • City: NORTH KINGSTOWN
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: SEAVIEW TRANSPORTATION CO INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Railcar CTCX 135391 was hooked up and offloading, it was coupled to 1 of 4 residue last contained rail cars which were scheduled to be switched out. In between the residue last contained and the full cars that were coupled together, there was a derail and blue flag applied to the rail track. Railroad personnel (on site conductor from Seaview) didn’t check to see if residue last contained cars were uncoupled from the full car (railroad procedure is for onsite conductor to verify that cars are uncoupled) and as such Seaview pulled the full car along with the residue last contained car. The full rail car also had a wheel chock on it. When the offloading (full) railcar was pulled, the bridge bent on rail tower and one liquid hose snapped off the pipe nipple. The railcar wheel went over top of derail and went over the wheel chock. The derail is designed to stop cars incoming but designed to stop from opposite direction (outgoing). One liquid hose snapped at fitting and propane released into air from the railcar and hose. This triggered the LEL detectors which initiated a shutdown, and all valves were closed. The hose released until nothing was left from end of valve to tip of hose. While the rail car was still releasing an operator climbed car and turned a valve on top of rail car at 3:30 pm. • 3: 25 pm-start of incident. • 3:30 pm-Site operator turned valve on top of railcar to stop release. • 3:45 pm-- fire dept on site. No vapor cloud observed but did smell residual odor. • 4:00 pm--Alex on site. • Shortly after 4:00 pm RI Dept of Env Mgt arrived. DEM requested report to be filed with NRC. NRC report number 1418172. DEM contact was Jason Kasawa, 401-255-2910. • 5:00 pm- The facility was cleared by fire dept to unhook railcar. Site personnel unhooked rail car and derailed it and closed it so Seaview could move it back on track. Fire dept requested the facility to lock process on damaged arm. • 5:15 pm-Fire Dept returned control to facility. Estimated quantity: Less than 50 gallons. Estimate based on end of valve tip of hose (approx. 20 ft) 2 mins of release before valve was closed to railcar.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS Transportation driver was scheduled to deliver a shipment of Ferric Chloride to Pilgrims Pride. He was filling the tank and was 450 gallons from the tank being full on the gaging system when it begin to overflow into containment. The driver was watching the offload and immediately shut down the transfer of materials. Approximately 20 gallons of Ferric Chloride Solution overflowed and 100% of it was contained in the containment at the site. There were no injuries or exposes during the release.

  • Description: Delta's DG Management Group was notified on 11/23/2024 of a cell phone overheat event that occurred on 11/22/2024 during during the deplaning phase of flight(DL602). A passenger's cell phone overheated and a fire was observed. The customer used a beverage to extinguish the flame that immediately mitigated the event. The flight attendant was ready to use a fire extinguisher if needed. No injuries were reported. The crew initiated a gate evacuation via forward boarding door using same direction of deplaning. The NRC and FAA were notified. 1
